metadata.title: Prospect and application of Internet of Things technology for prevention of SARIs
metadata.abstract: The Internet of Things (IoT) includes three core procedures: full spectrum perception, reliable transmission, and intelligent processing. It can be applied for the prevention and control of SARI (severe acute respiratory infection). By combining sensors, information technology, artificial intelligence, and available dynamic networking devices, IoT could realize long-distance communication between hospitals, patients, and medical devices, which could ultimately improve current medical conditions.
metadata.author: Yuanlin Song, Jinjun Jiang, Xun Wang, Dawei Yang, Chunxue Bai

introduction: The Internet of Things (IoT) includes three core procedures: full spectrum perception, reliable transmission, and intelligent processing. It can be applied for the prevention and control of SARI (severe acute respiratory infection). By combining sensors, information technology, artificial intelligence, and available dynamic networking devices, IoT could realize long-distance communication between hospitals, patients, and medical devices, which could ultimately improve current medical conditions.

Abstract: The Internet of Things (IoT) includes three core procedures: full spectrum perception, reliable transmission, and intelligent processing. It can be applied for the prevention and control of SARI (severe acute respiratory infection). By combining sensors, information technology, artificial intelligence, and available dynamic networking devices, IoT could realize long-distance communication between hospitals, patients, and medical devices, which could ultimately improve current medical conditions.

summary: The Internet of Things (IoT) includes three core procedures: full spectrum perception, reliable transmission, and intelligent processing.

Conclusion: The Internet of Things (IoT) includes three core procedures: full spectrum perception, reliable transmission, and intelligent processing.
